main event: Three objects in a trail followed a fast-moving object at around 750 mph over Albuquerque, New Mexico on December 29, 1950.
interesting points: The objects were tracked on radar for 10-15 minutes.
An early analysis suggested the sighting was likely just a balloon.
There were no photographs included in the report.
The report was part of Project Blue Book, the U.S. Air Force's official investigation of UFOs.
The conclusion was that the sighting was a balloon.
sighted object: three objects following a fast-moving object
location: 8 miles northwest of Albuquerque, New Mexico
